body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.48-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1893/folder/13176877/41237360/1005353780?sort=%2Bidentifier **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** n/a **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.4.1 Safari, Desktop, iPhone 13 iOS 18.6.2 Safari, Hybrid **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: Precondition; Account has a Self DM 1. Navigate to https://staging.new.expensify.com 2. Navigate to the Self DM 3. Track a scan expense with a random image as receipt to make smart scan failed 4. Click the expense preview while scanning 5. Wait until smart scanning fails ## Expected Result: After smart scanning fails, the amount and merchant fields are empty and have the error state displayed, a red dot should appear in the report chat in LHN. The expense header should be updated to "Receipt missing details" ## Actual Result: After smart scanning failure, there is a Concierge message, "Receipt scanning failed. Please enter the details manually", but the smart scan is still in progress (Receipt scanning is displayed in expense report header and LHN, and a scanning status is still displayed in the Amount and Merchant fields), the data is updated only after reopening expense report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/95d96085-831e-45e7-94d5-cf2938f450fa [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.48-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1893/folder/13176730/41237114/1005353630 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jodsinjoijdojds@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Account has self DM and a workspace 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to self DM 3. Create two expenses of different currency 4. Go to workspace chat 5. Create an empty report 6. Open the empty report 7. Click Add expense > Add unreported expense 8. Select both expenses from Step 3 9. Click Add to report ## Expected Result: Out-of-pocket spend & Company spend will not appear because both expenses are non-reimbursable ## Actual Result: Out-of-pocket spend & Company spend appears when non-reimbursable expenses of different currency are added to the report Out-of-pocket spend & Company spend disappear after refreshing the page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

title: Upgrade cocoapods to 1.16.2+

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem
A little while ago, we [attempted to upgrade cocoapods to 1.16](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70917/files) to patch a vulnerability.

However, the snyk PR was not correct on its own - it did not upgrade the `Podfile.lock`, so `bundle exec pod install` started failing.

### Solution
Upgrade cocoapods to `1.16.2+`. Update Pods and `Podfile.lock` accordingly.

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @QichenZhu</details>

Login with gmail account> Finish the onboarding process 2. Go to FAB> Track distance> Manual> Add amount> Next 3. On Choose recipient modal add any user email address 4. body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.48-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1879/folder/13176818/41237277/1002489344 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2040@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create a manual expense with a merchant that wasn´t used before and without category. 4. Open the just created expense. 5. Wait until whisper to categorize expense appears. 6. Select any option to categorize expense. 7. Note that a "Changed the category based on past activity" system message appears, despite no expense being categorized with the same merchant before. ## Expected Result: "Changed the category based on past activity to XX" system message, should only appear when the expense is automatically categorized, because merchant is the same as in a previously categorized expense. When categorizing for the first time, correct system message should be "Set the category to XX" ## Actual Result: When categorizing expense via whisper for the first time, a "Changed the category based on past activity to XX" system message appears, despite not having categorized an expense with the same merchant before. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6566499c-fcc7-4d4c-a0c4-7acd88a88c23 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
